ability_1: Claws.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (2d4 + 1) piercing damage.
ability_2: Needles.;; Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d6 + 1) piercing damage.
name: Needle Blight

ability_1: Spellcasting.;; The necromancer is a 12th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). The necromancer has the following wizard spells prepared:
ability_10: Grim Harvest (1/Turn).;; When necromancer kills a creature that is neither a construct nor undead with a spell of 1st level or higher, the necromancer regains hit points equal to twice the spell’s level, or three times if it is a necromancy spell.
ability_11: Withering Touch.;; Melee Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (2d4) necrotic damage.
ability_2: ||ADDENDUM||Cantrips (at will): chill touch, dancing lights, mage hand, mending
ability_3: ||ADDENDUM||1st level (4 slots):false life
ability_4: ||ADDENDUM||2nd level (3 slots): blindness/deafness
ability_5: ||ADDENDUM||3rd level (3 slots): animate dead
ability_6: ||ADDENDUM||4th level (3 slots): blight*, dimension door, stoneskin
ability_7: ||ADDENDUM||5th level (2 slots): Bigby’s hand, cloudkill
ability_8: ||ADDENDUM||6th level (1 slot): circle of death*
ability_9: ||ADDENDUM||*Necromancy spell of 1st level or higher
damage_resistances: necrotic
name: Necromancer

ability_1: Spellcasting.;; Naxene is a 6th level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 13; +5 to hit with spell attacks). She has the following wizard spells prepared:
ability_10: ||ADDENDUM|| “I’m too smart to be wrong about anything.”
ability_2: ||ADDENDUM||Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, light, mage hand, prestidigitation
ability_3: ||ADDENDUM||1st level (4 slots): mage armor, magic missile, shield
ability_4: ||ADDENDUM||2nd level (3 slots): misty step, suggestion
ability_5: ||ADDENDUM||3rd level (3 slots): fly, lightning bolt
ability_6: Staff.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 2 (1d6-1) bludgeoning damage, or 3 (1d8-1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.
ability_7: ||ADDENDUM||Goldenfields’ crops are vital Waterdeep’s survival, which is why the Watchful Order of Magists and Protectors sent Naxene to make sure the temple-farm is adeuately defended. At first she regarded the task as a punishment, but now she appreciates the peace and quiet.
ability_8: ||ADDENDUM|| “There’s no problem that can’t be solved with magic.”
ability_9: ||ADDENDUM|| “I have great respect for Lady Laeral Silverhand of Waterdeep. She and the Lords’ Alliance are going to bring some much-needed order to this lawless land.”
name: Naxene Drathkala

ability_1: Diabolical Sense.;; The narzugon has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks made to perceive good-aligned creatures.
ability_2: Infernal Tack.;; The narzugon wears spurs that are part of infernal tack, which allow it to summon its nightmare companion.
ability_3: Magic Resistance.;; The narzugon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
ability_4: Multiattack;; The narzugon uses its Infernal Command or Terrifying Command. It also makes three hellfire lance attacks.
ability_5:
Hellfire Lance;; Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d12 + 5) piercing damage plus 16 (3d10) fire damage. If this damage kills a creature, the creature’s soul rises from the River Styx as a lemure in Avernus in 1d4 hours.
If the creature isn’t revived before then, only a wish spell or killing the lemure and casting true resurrection on the creature’s original body can restore it to life. Constructs and devils are immune to this effect.
ability_6: Infernal Command;; Each ally of the narzugon within 60 feet of it can’t be charmed or frightened until the end of the narzugon’s next turn.
ability_7:
Terrifying Command;; Each creature that isn’t a fiend within 60 feet of the narzugon that can hear it must succeed on a DC 17 Charisma saving throw or become frightened of it for 1 minute.
A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that makes a successful saving throw is immune to this narzugon’s Terrifying Command for 24 hours.
ability_8: Healing (1/Day);; The narzugon, or one creature it touches, regains up to 100 hit points.
damage_resistances: acid, cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered
name: Narzugon

ability_1: Cunning Action.;; On each of his turns, Narth can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.
ability_2: Shortsword.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) piercing damage.
ability_3: Hand Crossbow.;; Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) piercing damage. Narth carries twenty crossbow bolts.
ability_4: ||ADDENDUM||Narth sells gear to adventurers, and he also has an adventurous spirit. The Lionshield Coster pays him well, but he longs to make a name for himself. At the same time, he runsa a business with his partner Alaestra and knows she wouldn’t forgive him if he ran off and never returned.
ability_5: ||ADDENDUM|| “The bigger the risk, the greater the reward.”
ability_6: ||ADDENDUM|| “I adore my colleague Alestra, and I’d like to do something to impress her.”
ability_7: ||ADDENDUM|| “I’ll risk life and limb to become a legend.-“
name: Narth Tezrin

ability_1: Insanity.;; Droki has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.
ability_10: One with Shadows.;; While he is in a dim light or darkness, Narrak can become invisible. He remains so until he moves or takes an action or reaction.
ability_2: Magic Resistance.;; The derro has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
ability_3: Spellcasting.;; Narrak is a 5th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (Save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks) Narrak has two 2nd-level spell slots, which he regains after finishing a short or long rest, and knows the following Warlock spells:»>
ability_4: ||ADDENDUM||Cantrips (at will): eldritch blast, friends, poison spray
ability_5: ||ADDENDUM||1st level: armor of Agathys, charm person, hex
ability_6: ||ADDENDUM||2nd level: hold person, ray of enfeeblement, spider climb
ability_7: Sunlight Sensitivity.;; While in sunlight, the derro has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
ability_8: Armor of Shadows (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest).;; Narrak casts mage armor on himself
ability_9: Shortsword.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.
name: Narrak

ability_1: Magic Resistance.;; The nalfeshnee has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
ability_2: Multiattack.;; The nalfeshnee uses Horror Nimbus if it can.  It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.
ability_3: Bite.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 32 (5d10 + 5) piercing damage.
ability_4: Claw.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) slashing damage.
ability_5: Horror Nimbus (Recharge 5-6).;; The nalfeshnee magically emits scintillating, multicolored light. Each creature within 15 feet of the nalfeshnee that can see the light must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature’s saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the nalfeshnee’s Horror Nimbus for the next 24 hours.
ability_6: Teleport.;; The nalfeshnee magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.
ability_7: Variant: Summon Demon (1/Day).;; The demon chooses what to summon and attempts a magical summoning.
ability_8: ||ADDENDUM||A nalfeshnee has a 50 percent chance of summoning 1d4 vrocks, 1d3 hezrous, 1d2 glabrezus, or one nalfeshnee.
ability_9: ||ADDENDUM||A summoned demon appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can’t summon other demons. It remains for 1 minute, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.
damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
name: Nalfeshnee

ability_1: Corruption.;; As a bonus action, the nagpa targets one creature it can see within 90 feet of it. The target must make a DC 20 Charisma saving throw. An evil creature makes the save with disadvantage. On a failed save, the target is charmed by the nagpa until the start of the nagpa’s next turn. On a successful save, the target becomes immune to the nagpa’s Corruption for the next 24 hours.
ability_2: Paralysis (Recharge 6).;; As a bonus action, the nagpa forces each creature within 30 feet of it to succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. A paralyzed target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Undead and constructs are immune to this effect.
ability_3: Spellcasting.;; The nagpa is a 15th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence. A nagpa has the following wizard spells prepared:
ability_4: Staff;; Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.
languages: Common plus up to five other languages
name: Nagpa

ability_1: Sunlight Sensitivity.;; While in sunlight, Naergoth has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
ability_2: Multiattack.;; Naergoth makes three attacks, either with his longsword or longbow. He can use Life Drain in place of one longsword attack.
ability_3: Life Drain.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (5d6 + 3) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.
ability_4: Longsword.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage, or 10 (1d10 + 5) if used with two hands, plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.
ability_5: Longbow.;; Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.
damage_resistances: necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered
name: Naergoth Bladelord

ability_1: Demonic Shadows.;; The nabassu darkens the area around its body in a 10-foot radius. Nonmagical light can’t illuminate this area of dim light.
ability_2: Devour Soul.;; A nabassu can eat the soul of a creature it has killed within the last hour, provided that creature is neither a construct nor an undead. The devouring requires the nabassu to be within 5 feet of the corpse for at least 10 minutes, after which it gains a number of Hit Dice (d8s) equal to half the creature’s number of Hit Dice. Roll those dice, and increase the nabassu’s hit points by the numbers rolled. For every 4 Hit Dice the nabassu gains in this way, its attacks deal an extra 3 (1d6) damage on a hit. The nabassu retains these benefits for 6 days. A creature devoured by a nabassu can be restored to life only by a wish spell.
ability_3: Magic Resistance.;; The nabassu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
ability_4: Magic Weapons.;; The nabassu’s weapon attacks are magical.
ability_5: Multiattack;; The nabassu uses its Soul-Stealing Gaze and makes two attacks: one with its claws and one with its bite.
ability_6: Claws;; Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) slashing damage.
ability_7: Bite;; Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 32 (4d12 + 6) piercing damage.
ability_8: Soul-Stealing Gaze;; The nabassu targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the nabassu and isn’t a construct or an undead, it must succeed on a DC 16 Charisma saving throw or reduce its hit point maximum by 13 (2d12) damage and give the nabassu an equal number of temporary hit points. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0, and if the target is a humanoid, it immediately rises as a ghoul under the nabassu’s control.
damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
name: Nabassu

ability_1: Distress Spores.;; When the myconid takes damage, all other myconids within 240 feet of it can sense its pain.
ability_2: Sun Sickness.;; While in sunlight, the myconid has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. The myconid dies if it spends more than 1 hour in direct sunlight.
ability_3: Fist.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 (1d4- 1) bludgeoning damage plus 2 (1d4) poison damage.
ability_4: Rapport Spores (3/Day).;; A 10-foot radius of spores extends from the myconid. These spores can go around corners and affect only creatures with an Intelligence of 2 or higher that aren’t undead, constructs, or elementals. Affected creatures can communicate telepathically with one another while they are within 30 feet of each other. The effect lasts for 1 hour.
name: Myconid Sprout

ability_1: Distress Spores.;; When the myconid takes damage, all other myconids within 240 feet of it can sense its pain.
ability_2: Sun Sickness.;; While in sunlight, the myconid has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. The myconid dies if it spends more than 1 hour in direct sunlight.
ability_3: Multiattack.;; The myconid uses either its Hallucination Spores or its Pacifying Spores, then makes a fist attack.
ability_4: Fist.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (3d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (3d4) poison damage.
ability_5: Animating Spores.;; The myconid targets one corpse of a humanoid or a Large or smaller beast within 5 feet of it and releases spores at the corpse. In 24 hours, the corpse rises as a spore servant. The corpse stays animated for 1d4 + 1 weeks or until destroyed, and it can’t be animated again in this way.
ability_6: Hallucination Spores.;; The myconid ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. The poisoned target is incapacitated while it hallucinates. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
ability_7: Pacifying Spores.;; The myconid ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be stunned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
ability_8: Rapport Spores.;; A 30-foot radius of spores extends from the myconid. These spores can go around corners and affect only creatures with an Intelligence of 2 or higher that aren’t undead, constructs, or elementals. Affected creatures can communicate telepathically with one another while they are within 30 feet of each other. The effect lasts for 1 hour.
name: Myconid Sovereign

ability_1: Distress Spores.;; When the myconid takes damage, all other myconids within 240 feet of it can sense its pain.
ability_2: Sun Sickness.;; While in sunlight, the myconid has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. The myconid dies if it spends more than 1 hour in direct sunlight.
ability_3: Fist.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (2d4) bludgeoning damage plus 5 (2d4) poison damage.
ability_4: Pacifying Spores (3/Day).;; The myconid ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or be stunned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
ability_5: Rapport Spores.;; A 20-foot radius of spores extends from the myconid. These spores can go around corners and affect only creatures with an Intelligence of 2 or higher that aren’t undead, constructs, or elementals. Affected creatures can communicate telepathically with one another while they are within 30 feet of each other. The effect lasts for 1 hour.
name: Myconid Adult

ability_1: Magic Resistance.;; The mummy lord has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
ability_10: Blasphemous Word (Costs 2 Actions).;; The mummy lord utters a blasphemous word. Each non-undead creature within 10 feet of the mummy lord that can hear the magical utterance must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of the mummy lord’s next turn.
ability_11: Channel Negative Energy (Costs 2 Actions).;; The mummy lord magically unleashes negative energy. Creatures within 60 feet of the mummy lord, including ones behind barriers and around corners, can’t regain hit points until the end of the mummy lord’s next turn.
ability_12: Whirlwind of Sand (Costs 2 Actions).;; The mummy lord magically transforms into a whirlwind of sand, moves up to 60 feet, and reverts to its normal form. While in whirlwind form, the mummy lord is immune to all damage, and it can’t be grappled, petrified, knocked prone, restrained, or stunned. Equipment worn or carried by the mummy lord remain in its possession.
ability_2: Rejuvenation.;; A destroyed mummy lord gains a new body in 24 hours if its heart is intact, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the mummy lord’s heart.
ability_3: Spellcasting.;; The mummy lord is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). The mummy lord has the following cleric spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): sacred flame, thaumaturgy++1st level (4 slots): command, guiding bolt, shield of faith++2nd level (3 slots): hold person, silence, spiritual weapon++3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, dispel magic++4th level (3 slots): divination, guardian of faith++5th level (2 slots): contagion, insect plague++6th level (1 slot): harm
ability_4: Multiattack.;; The mummy can use its Dreadful Glare and makes one attack with its rotting fist.
ability_5: Rotting Fist.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 21 (6d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with mummy rot. The cursed target can’t regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by 10 (3d6) for every 24 hours that elapse. If the curse reduces the target’s hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and its body turns to dust. The curse lasts until removed by the remove curse spell or other magic.
ability_6: Dreadful Glare.;; The mummy lord targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the mummy lord, it must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become frightened until the end of the mummy’s next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also paralyzed for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all mummies and mummy lords for the next 24 hours.
ability_7: ||ADDENDUM||The mummy lord can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The mummy lord regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.
ability_8: Attack.;; The mummy lord makes one attack with its rotting fist or uses its Dreadful Glare.
ability_9: Blinding Dust.;; Blinding dust and sand swirls magically around the mummy lord. Each creature within 5 feet of the mummy lord must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of the creature’s next turn.
damage_immunities: necrotic, poison, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
languages: the languages it knew in life
name: Mummy Lord

ability_1: Multiattack.;; The mummy can use its Dreadful Glare and makes one attack with its rotting fist.
ability_2: Rotting Fist.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with mummy rot. The cursed target can’t regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by 10 (3d6) for every 24 hours that elapse. If the curse reduces the target’s hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and its body turns to dust. The curse lasts until removed by the remove curse spell or other magic.
ability_3: Dreadful Glare.;; The mummy targets one creature it can see within 60 ft. of it. If the target can see the mummy, it must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become frightened until the end of the mummy’s next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also paralyzed for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all mummies (but not mummy lords) for the next 24 hours.
damage_immunities: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
languages: the languages it knew in life
name: Mummy

ability_1: Beast of Burden.;; The mule is considered to be a Large animal for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.
ability_2: Sure-Footed.;; The mule has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.
ability_3: Hooves.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.
name: Mule

ability_1: Spellcasting.;; Muiral is a 13th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following wizard spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): dancing lights, mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost, shocking grasp++1st level (4 slots): expeditious retreat, fog cloud, magic missile, shield++2nd level (3 slots): darkness, knock, see invisibility, spider climb++3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, counterspell, lightning bolt++4th level (3 slots): greater invisibility, polymorph++5th level (2 slots): animate objects, wall of force++6th level (1 slot): create undead, flesh to stone++7th level (1 slot): finger of death
ability_2: Legendary Resistance (3/Day).;; If Muiral fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.
ability_3: Multiattack.;; Muiral makes three attacks: two with his longsword and one with his sting.
ability_4: Longsword.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 15 (2d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands.
ability_5: Sting.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage. The target must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw, taking 27 (6d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
ability_6: ||ADDENDUM||Muiral can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. Muiral regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.
ability_7: Cast Cantrip.;; Muiral casts a cantrip.
ability_8: Lunging Attack (Costs 2 Actions).;; Muiral makes one longsword attack that has a reach of 10 feet.
ability_9: Retreating Strike (Costs 3 Actions).;; Muiral moves up to his speed without provoking opportunity attacks. Before the move, he can make one longsword attack.
name: Muiral

ability_1: Death Burst.;; When the mephit dies, it explodes in a burst of sticky mud. Each Medium or smaller creature within 5 ft. of it must succeed on a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw or be restrained until the end of the creature’s next turn.
ability_2: False Appearance.;; While the mephit remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary mound of mud.
ability_3: Fists.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage.
ability_4: Mud Breath (Recharge 6).;; The mephit belches viscid mud onto one creature within 5 ft. of it. If the target is Medium or smaller, it must succeed on a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw or be restrained for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
ability_5: Variant: Summon Mephits (1/Day).;; The mephit has a 25 percent chance of summoning 1d4 mephits of its kind. A summoned mephit appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can’t summon other mephits. It remains for 1 minute, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.
name: Mud Mephit

ability_1: Mouth of Madness.;; The giant is immune to confusion spells and similar magic.
ability_2: ||ADDENDUM||1-3. The giant makes three attacks with its fists against one random target within its reach. If no other creatures are within its reach, the giant flies into a rage and gains advantage on all attack rolls until the end of its next turn.
ability_3: ||ADDENDUM||4-5. The giant makes one attack with its fist against every creature within its reach. If no other creatures are within its reach, the giant makes one fist attack against itself.
ability_4: ||ADDENDUM||6-7. The giant makes one attack with its bite against one random target within its reach. If no other creatures are within its reach, its eyes glaze over and it becomes stunned until the start of its next turn.
ability_5: ||ADDENDUM||8-10. The giant makes three attacks against one random target within its reach: one attack with its bite and two with its fists. If no other creatures are within its reach, the giant flies into a rage and gains advantage on all attack rolls until the end of its next turn.
ability_6: Bite.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 15 (3d6+5) piercing damage, and the giant magically regains hit points equal to the damage dealt.
ability_7: Fist.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft, one target. Hit: 18 (3d8+5) bludgeoning damage.
name: Mouth of Grolantor

ability_1: Incorporeal Movement.;; The wraith can move through an object or another creature, but can’t stop there.
ability_2: Sunlight Sensitivity.;; While in sunlight, the wraith has disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
ability_3: Life Drain.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 16 (3d8 + 3) necrotic damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. If this attack reduces the target’s hit point maximum to 0, the target dies. This reduction to the target’s hit point maximum lasts until the target finishes a long rest.
condition_immunities: charmed, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained
damage_resistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered
name: Mormesk the Wraith

ability_1: Amphibious.;; The morkoth can breathe air and water.
ability_10: Multiattack.;; The morkoth makes three attacks: two with its bite and one with its tentacles or three with its bite.
ability_11: Bite.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 9 (2d6+2) slashing damage.
ability_12: Tentacles.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d8+2) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 14) if it is a Large or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends. the target is restrained and takes 15 (3d8+2) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of the morkoth’s turns. and the morkoth can’t use its tentacles on another target.
ability_13: Hypnosis.;; The morkoth projects a 30-foot cone of magical energy. Each creature in that area must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is charmed by the morkoth for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, the target tries to get as close to the morkoth as possible, using its actions to Dash until it is within 5 feet of the morkoth. A charmed target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns and whenever it takes damage, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature’s saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature has advantage on saving throws against the morkoth’s Hypnosis for 24 hours.
ability_14: Spell Reflection.;; If the morkoth makes a successful saving throw against a spell, or a spell attack misses it, the morkoth can choose another creature (including the spellcaster) it can see within 120 feet of it. The spell targets the chosen creature instead of the morkoth. If the spell forced a saving throw, the chosen creature makes its own save. If the spell was an attack, the attack roll is rerolled against the chosen creature.
ability_2: Spellcasting.;; The morkoth is an 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). The morkoth has the following wizard spells prepared:
ability_3: ||ADDENDUM||Cantrips (at will): acid splash, mage hand, mending, ray of frost, shocking grasp
ability_4: ||ADDENDUM||1st level (4 slots): detect magic, identify, shield, witch bolt
ability_5: ||ADDENDUM||2nd level (3 slots): darkness, detect thoughts, shatter
ability_6: ||ADDENDUM||3rd level (3 slots): dispel magic, lightning bolt, sending
ability_7: ||ADDENDUM||4th level (3 slots): dimension door, Evard’s black tentacles
ability_8: ||ADDENDUM||5th level (3 slots): geas, scrying
ability_9: ||ADDENDUM||6th level (1 slot): chain lightning
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
name: Morkoth

ability_1: Axiomatic Mind.;; The monodrone can’t be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.
ability_2: Disintegration.;; If the monodrone dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind its weapons and anything else it was carrying.
ability_3: Dagger.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.
ability_4: Javelin.;; Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6) piercing damage.
name: Monodrone

ability_1: Extraordinary Feature.;; The mongrelfolk has one of the following extraordinary features, determined randomly by rolling a d20 or chosen by the DM:
ability_10: Multiattack.;; The mongrelfolk makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claw or dagger.
ability_11: Bite.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4+1) piercing damage.
ability_12: Claw.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4+1) slashing damage.
ability_13: Dagger.;; Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4+1) piercing damage.
ability_2: ||ADDENDUM||1-3 - Amphibious: The mongrelfolk can breathe air and water.
ability_3: ||ADDENDUM||4-9 - Darkvision: The mongrelfolk has darkvision out to a range of 60 feet.
ability_4: ||ADDENDUM||10 - Flight: The mongrelfolk has leathery wings and a flying speed of 40 feet.
ability_5: ||ADDENDUM||11-15 - Keen Hearing and Smell: The mongrelfolk has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.
ability_6: ||ADDENDUM||16-17 - Spider Climb: The mongrelfolk can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.
ability_7: ||ADDENDUM||18-19 - Standing Leap: The mongrelfolk’s long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.
ability_8: ||ADDENDUM||20 - Two-Headed: The mongrelfolk has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious.
ability_9: Mimicry.;; The mongrelfolk can mimic any sounds it has beard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 12 Wisdom (Insight) check.
name: Mongrelfolk

ability_1: Innate Spellcasting.;; The molydeus’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
ability_10: Attack;; The molydeus makes one attack, either with its demonic weapon or with its snakebite.
ability_11: Move;; The molydeus moves without provoking opportunity attacks.
ability_12: Cast a Spell;; The molydeus casts one spell from its Innate Spellcasting trait.
ability_2: Legendary Resistance (3/Day).;; If the molydeus fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.
ability_3: Magic Resistance.;; The molydeus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
ability_4: Magic Weapons.;; The molydeus’s weapon attacks are magical.
ability_5: Multiattack;; The molydeus makes three attacks: one with its weapon, one with its wolf bite, and one with its snakebite.
ability_6: Demonic Weapon;; Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (2d10 + 9) slashing damage. If the target has at least one head and the molydeus rolled a 20 on the attack roll, the target is decapitated and dies if it can’t survive without that head. A target is immune to this effect if it takes none of the damage, has legendary actions, or is Huge or larger. Such a creature takes an extra 6d8 slashing damage from the hit.
ability_7: Wolf Bite;; Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d6 + 9) piercing damage.
ability_8: Snakebite;; Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. Hit: 12 (1d6 + 9) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 22 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target transforms into a manes if this reduces its hit point maximum to 0. This transformation can be ended only by a wish spell.
ability_9: ||ADDENDUM||The molydeus can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The molydeus regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.
condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, poisoned, stunned
damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
name: Molydeus

ability_1: Innate Spellcasting.;; Moloch’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
ability_10: Breath of Despair (Recharge 5-6);; Moloch exhales in a 30-foot cube. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 21 Wisdom saving throw or take 27 (5d10) psychic damage, drop whatever it is holding, and become frightened for 1 minute. While frightened in this way, a creature must take the Dash action and move away from Moloch by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move, in which case it needn’t take the Dash action. If the creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn’t have line of sight to Moloch, the creature can repeat the saving throw. On a success, the effect ends.
ability_11: Teleport;; Moloch magically teleports, along with any equipment he is wearing and carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.
ability_12: ||ADDENDUM||Moloch can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. Moloch regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.
ability_13: Stinking Cloud;; Moloch casts stinking cloud.
ability_14: Teleport;; Moloch uses his Teleport action.
ability_15: Whip;; Moloch makes one attack with his whip.
ability_2: Legendary Resistance (3/Day).;; If Moloch fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.
ability_3: Magic Resistance.;; Moloch has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
ability_4: Magic Weapons.;; Moloch’s weapon attacks are magical.
ability_5: Regeneration.;; Moloch regains 20 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes radiant damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of his next turn. Moloch dies only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn’t regenerate.
ability_6: Multiattack;; Moloch makes three attacks: one with his bite, one with his claw, and one with his whip.
ability_7: Bite;; Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 26 (4d8 + 8) piercing damage.
ability_8: Claw;; Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d8 + 8) slashing damage.
ability_9: Many-Tailed Whip;; Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d4 + 8) slashing damage plus 11 (2d10) lightning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 24 Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 30 feet in a straight line toward Moloch.
damage_resistances: cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered
name: Moloch

ability_1: Bear Hug.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4+3) bludgeoning damage, and the target grappled (escape DC 13) and takes 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of Miros’s turns until the grapple ends. Miros cannot make attacks while grappling a creature.
ability_2: Club.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4+1) bludgeoning damage
ability_3: Heavy Crossbow.;; Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d10) piercing damage. Miros carries ten crossbow bolts.
ability_4: ||ADDENDUM||Innkeeper Miros is a retired carnival attraction, dubbed “the Yeti” because of his barrel-shaped body and the thick, white hair covering his arms, chest, back, and head. When Goldenfields suffers, so does his business, so he takes strides to protect the compound.
ability_5: ||ADDENDUM|| “As does the Emerald Enclave, I believe that civilization and the wilderness need to learn to coexist.”
ability_6: ||ADDENDUM|| “Make fun of me all you like, but don’t speak ill of my inn or my employees.”
ability_7: ||ADDENDUM|| “When something upsets me, I have a tendency to fly into a rage.”
name: Miros Xelbrin

ability_1: Earth Walk.;; Moving through difficult terrain made of earth or stone costs Miraj no extra movement.
ability_2: Innate Spellcasting.;; Miraj’s innate spellcasting ability is Constitution (spell save DC 14). He can innately cast the following spell, requiring no material components:
ability_3: Spellcasting.;; Miraj is an 11th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). He knows the following sorcerer spells:Cantrips (at will): acid splash, blade ward, friends, light, message, mold earth++1st level (4 slots): chromatic orb, mage armor, magic missile++2nd level (3 slots): Maximilian’s earthen grasp, shatter, suggestion++3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, erupting earth++4th level (3 slots): polymorph, stoneskin++5th level (2 slots): wall of stone++6th level (1 slot): move earth
ability_4: Staff.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) bludgeoning damage when used with two hands.
name: Miraj Vizann

ability_1: Charge.;; If the skeleton moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.
ability_2: Greataxe.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) slashing damage.
ability_3: Gore.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage.
name: Minotaur Skeleton

ability_1: Charge.;; If the minotaur moves at least 10 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 ft. away and knocked prone.
ability_2: Labyrinthine Recall.;; The minotaur can perfectly recall any path it has traveled.
ability_3: Reckless.;; At the start of its turn, the minotaur can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.
ability_4: Greataxe.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) slashing damage.
ability_5: Gore.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage.
name: Minotaur

ability_1: Telepathic Hub.;; When the mindwitness receives a telepathic message, it can telepathically share that message with up to seven other creatures within 600 feet of it that it can see.
ability_2: Multiattack.;; The mindwitness makes two attacks: one with its tentacles and one with its bite.
ability_3: Bite.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 16 (4d6+2) piercing damage.
ability_4: Tentacles.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 it, one creature. Hit: 20 (4d8+2) psychic damage. if the target is Large or smaller, it is grappled (escape DC 13) and must succeed on a DC 13 Intelligence saving throw or be stunned until this grapple ends.
ability_5: Eye Rays.;; Eye Rays. The mindwitness shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing one to three targets it can see within 120 feet of it:
name: Mindwitness

ability_1: Magic Resistance.;; The mind flayer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
ability_10: Extract Brain.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one incapacitated humanoid grappled by the mind flayer. Hit: The target takes 55 (10d10) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the mind flayer kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.
ability_11: Mind Blast (Recharge 5-6).;; The mind flayer magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 15 Intelligence saving throw or take 22 (4d8+4) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
ability_2: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics).;; The mind flayer is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 15; +7 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
ability_3: ||ADDENDUM||At will: guidance, mage hand, vicious mockery, true strike
ability_4: ||ADDENDUM||1st-level (4 slots): charm person, command, comprehend languages, sanctuary
ability_5: ||ADDENDUM||2nd level (3 slots): crown of madness, phantasmal force, see invisibility
ability_6: ||ADDENDUM||3rd level (3 slots): clairvoyance, fear, meld into stone
ability_7: ||ADDENDUM||4th level (3 slots): confusion, stone shape
ability_8: ||ADDENDUM||5th level (2 slots): scrying, telekinesis
ability_9: Tentacles.;; Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 15 (2dl0+4) psychic damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape DC 15) and must succeed on a DC 15 Intelligence saving throw or be stunned until this grapple ends.
name: Mind Flayer Psion
